mission: Content Pages Theme Audit - MT Ocean Theme Verification

editorial_typography_details.findings: All 20 pages use font-serif (Playfair Display) for headings with proper typographic hierarchy. Hero titles consistently use text-5xl/6xl/7xl, card titles use text-xl/2xl/3xl, and section headings use text-2xl/3xl/4xl. Font weights are appropriate (font-bold for H1, font-semibold for H2/H3). All pages demonstrate excellent editorial design principles.

ocean_themed_details.findings: All pages consistently use MT Ocean theme with shadcn Card components, hover-elevate interactions, glassmorphic badges (bg-white/10 backdrop-blur-sm border-white/30), gradient overlays (bg-gradient-to-b from-black/70 via-black/50 to-background), and ocean-themed primary/accent colors. Cards maintain consistent spacing (p-6, p-8), proper rounded corners, and ocean palette throughout.

dark_mode_optimized_details.findings: All pages support dark mode through semantic color tokens (text-foreground, bg-background, text-muted-foreground). Hero sections use text-white on dark gradient overlays which work perfectly in both modes. Some pages (BlogDetailPage, TeacherDetailPage) include explicit dark:prose-invert for long-form content. Reading experience is optimized with proper contrast ratios and theme-aware components.

i18n_complete_details.findings: CRITICAL: Zero i18n implementation found across all 20 content pages. All text is hard-coded in English with no useTranslation() hooks or t() function calls. Despite the platform having i18next configured with 6 language files (en, es, fr, de, it, pt), none of the content pages use the translation system. This is a blocking issue for internationalization.
missing_implementation: No 'import { useTranslation } from react-i18next' in any page
All UI labels, headings, descriptions, button text are hard-coded
Translation files exist but are not utilized by content pages

responsive_content_layouts_details.findings: All pages implement mobile-first responsive design with proper breakpoint classes (md:, lg:). Hero sections use responsive heights (h-[50vh] md:h-[60vh]), grids use responsive columns (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3), text scales progressively (text-4xl md:text-5xl lg:text-6xl), and containers use max-width constraints (max-w-4xl/6xl/7xl). All layouts adapt seamlessly across devices.

overall_status_explanation: While the pages excel in editorial typography (100%), ocean theming (100%), dark mode optimization (100%), and responsive layouts (100%), the complete absence of i18n implementation (0%) results in an overall FAIL status. This is a critical gap that must be addressed for production readiness.

critical_issues.description: No i18n implementation on any of the 20 content pages
critical_issues.impact: Platform cannot serve non-English users despite having 6 language files configured
critical_issues.required_action: Implement react-i18next with translation keys for all user-facing text

strengths: Excellent editorial typography with Playfair Display serif headings
Consistent MT Ocean theme implementation across all pages
Strong dark/light mode support via semantic tokens
Proper 16:9 hero sections with gradient overlays
Comprehensive responsive design with mobile-first approach

recommendations.action: Implement i18n across all 20 content pages
details: Add 'import { useTranslation } from react-i18next' to each page
Replace all hard-coded strings with t('translation.key') calls
Create translation keys in all 6 language files (en, es, fr, de, it, pt)
Test language switching on all pages
recommendations.estimated_effort: High - requires systematic updates across all pages

recommendations.action: Consider additional explicit dark mode variants
recommendations.details: While semantic tokens work well, consider adding explicit dark:prose-invert to all long-form content for enhanced readability

However, the complete absence of internationalization (i18n) across all pages is a critical blocker. Despite having i18next configured with 6 language files, none of the content pages implement translation keys. This must be addressed before production release.
